Session.Abandon\ RedirectWithFlash "customers.asp", "You have been logged out."\ %>\ } ### FILE: includes/orders.asp {\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252\cocoartf2867 \cocoatextscaling0\cocoaplatform0{\fonttbl\f0\fswiss\fcharset0 Helvetica;} {\colortbl;\red255\green255\blue255;} {\*\expandedcolortbl;;} \margl1440\margr1440\vieww11520\viewh8400\viewkind0 \pard\tx720\tx1440\tx2160\tx2880\tx3600\tx4320\tx5040\tx5760\tx6480\tx7200\tx7920\tx8640\pardirnatural\partightenfactor0 \f0\fs24 \cf0 <%@ Language="VBScript" %>\ \ \ <%\ Option Explicit\ \ Call EnsureInMemoryData()\ Call RequireLogin()\ \ Dim action\ action = LCase(Trim(Request("action")))\ \ Select Case action\ Case "create"\ Call HandleCreate()\ Case "update"\ Call HandleUpdate()\ End Select\ \ Sub HandleCreate()\ Dim custId, status, total\ custId = CLng(0)\ status = Trim(Request.Form("status"))\ total = CDbl(0)\ \ On Error Resume Next\ custId = CLng(Request.Form("customerId"))\ total = CDbl(Request.Form("total"))\ On Error GoTo 0\ \ If custId <= 0 Or status = "" Or total <= 0 Then\ RedirectWithFlash "orders.asp", "All fields are required, total must be > 0."\ End If\ \ Dim orders, nextId\ Set orders = Application("Orders")\ \ Application.Lock\ nextId = CLng(Application("NextOrderId"))\ orders.Add nextId, Array(custId, status, total, Now())\ Application("NextOrderId") = nextId + 1\ Application.UnLock\ \ RedirectWithFlash "orders.asp", "Order " & nextId & " created."\ End Sub\ \ Sub HandleUpdate()\ Dim orderId, newStatus\ orderId = CLng(0)\ On Error Resume Next\ orderId = CLng(Request.Form("orderId"))\ On Error GoTo 0\ \ newStatus = Trim(Request.Form("newStatus"))\ If orderId <= 0 Or newStatus = "" Then\ RedirectWithFlash "orders.asp", "Order ID and new status are required."\ End If\ \ Dim orders\ Set orders = Application("Orders")\ \ If Not orders.Exists(orderId) Then\ RedirectWithFlash "orders.asp", "Order not found."\ End If\ \ Dim data\ data = orders(orderId)\ \ Dim custId, total, createdAt\ custId = data(0)\ total = data(2)\ createdAt = data(3)\ \ Application.Lock\ orders(orderId) = Array(custId, newStatus, total, createdAt)\ Application.UnLock\ \ RedirectWithFlash "orders.asp", "Order " & orderId & " updated."\ End Sub\ \ Call RenderHeader("Orders")\ %>\ \

IDCustomerStatusTotalCreatedUpdate status
<%=oid%><%=HtmlEncode(custName)%><%=HtmlEncode(status)%><%=FormatCurrency(total, 2)%><%=createdAt%>\

system_context_model.summary: Legacy ASP application for managing customer orders, sessions, and authentication, targeted for modernization to TypeScript.

convention_profile.summary: Analysis of legacy ASP codebase for modernization to TypeScript, focusing on naming conventions, error handling, and security.

rules.rule: Validate all user inputs to prevent injection attacks.

lint_recommendations: Ensure consistent naming conventions across the codebase.
Implement structured error handling using try-catch blocks in TypeScript.
Validate and sanitize all user inputs to prevent security vulnerabilities.
scaffold_templates: TypeScript service template for handling user sessions and authentication.
TypeScript component template for rendering HTML with security in mind.

health_assessment.summary: Health assessment of the legacy ASP codebase, identifying key areas for improvement in maintainability, security, and reliability.

hotspots.reason: Potential for injection attacks due to insufficient input validation.

risks.title: Security Vulnerability
risks.description: Potential for injection attacks due to insufficient input validation.

risks.title: Error Handling Deficiency
risks.description: Lack of structured error handling could lead to unhandled exceptions.

remediation_backlog.title: Implement Input Validation
remediation_backlog.problem_statement: User inputs are not properly validated, leading to potential security vulnerabilities.
remediation_backlog.suggested_approach: Implement input validation and sanitization using TypeScript libraries.
success_criteria: All user inputs are validated and sanitized.
No security vulnerabilities related to input handling.

remediation_backlog.title: Implement Structured Error Handling
remediation_backlog.problem_statement: Current error handling is insufficient and unstructured.
remediation_backlog.risk_if_unaddressed: Potential for unhandled exceptions leading to application crashes.
remediation_backlog.suggested_approach: Use try-catch blocks in TypeScript to handle errors gracefully.
success_criteria: All potential error points are covered with try-catch blocks.
Application does not crash due to unhandled exceptions.

agent_results.summary: Extracted 8 functional requirements, 5 non-functional requirements, 4 risks, 2 clarifications, 0 failed quality gates [software-general-v1]

analysis_walkthrough.business_objective_summary: Modernize a legacy ASP codebase to TypeScript, ensuring functionality is preserved and documented, with deployment for testing in Docker.
requirements_understanding: The legacy codebase includes session management, customer login, and order processing.
The modernization effort requires TypeScript as the target language.
Backward compatibility and functionality parity are critical.
Deployment for local Docker testing is required.
conversion_to_technical_requirements: Each ASP script function will be mapped to a TypeScript function or module.
Session management will be handled using a modern session library compatible with TypeScript.
Customer and order data will be managed using a TypeScript-compatible data store.
Docker will be used for containerized testing environments.
clarifications_requested: Are there any specific TypeScript frameworks or libraries that should be used?
What are the performance expectations for the modernized application?

output.executive_summary: This project aims to modernize a legacy ASP codebase to TypeScript, preserving existing functionality and ensuring compatibility, with deployment for Docker-based testing.

functional_requirements.title: Session Management
functional_requirements.description: Implement session management in TypeScript to track user sessions and total active sessions.
acceptance_criteria: Session start increases the total session count by 1.
Session end decreases the total session count by 1.
Sessions store user authentication status and username.

functional_requirements.title: User Authentication
functional_requirements.description: Implement user login functionality in TypeScript, allowing users to authenticate with a username.
acceptance_criteria: User login requires a non-empty username.
Successful login sets session as authenticated and stores the username.
Failed login due to empty username displays an error message.

functional_requirements.title: Customer Data Management
functional_requirements.description: Manage customer data in TypeScript, allowing retrieval and display of customer information.
acceptance_criteria: Customer data is stored in a TypeScript-compatible data store.
Customer list is displayed with ID and name.
Customer data retrieval is secure and efficient.

functional_requirements.title: Order Creation
functional_requirements.description: Implement order creation functionality in TypeScript, allowing users to create new orders.
acceptance_criteria: Order creation requires customer ID, status, and total amount.
Orders are stored with a unique ID and timestamp.
Invalid input results in an error message and no order is created.

functional_requirements.title: Order Update
functional_requirements.description: Implement order update functionality in TypeScript, allowing users to update order status.
acceptance_criteria: Order updates require a valid order ID and new status.
Order status is updated in the data store.
Invalid order ID results in an error message.

functional_requirements.title: Data Encoding
functional_requirements.description: Ensure all user inputs and outputs are properly encoded to prevent security vulnerabilities.
acceptance_criteria: All HTML outputs are encoded to prevent XSS attacks.
All inputs are validated and sanitized.
Encoding functions are tested for edge cases.

functional_requirements.title: Flash Messaging
functional_requirements.description: Implement flash messaging in TypeScript to provide feedback to users on actions.
acceptance_criteria: Flash messages are displayed after user actions.
Messages are cleared after being displayed once.
Flash messages support different types (info, error).

functional_requirements.title: Docker Deployment
functional_requirements.description: Deploy the modernized application in a Docker container for local testing.
acceptance_criteria: Application runs successfully in a Docker container.
Docker setup includes all necessary dependencies.
Application is accessible via a local URL.

non_functional_requirements.title: Performance
non_functional_requirements.description: The modernized application should perform efficiently under expected load.
non_functional_requirements.metric: Response time under 200ms for 95% of requests.
acceptance_criteria: Load testing shows response time under 200ms for 95% of requests.
Application scales to handle 100 concurrent users.
Performance metrics are logged and monitored.

non_functional_requirements.title: Security
non_functional_requirements.description: Ensure the application is secure against common vulnerabilities.
non_functional_requirements.metric: No critical vulnerabilities in security scans.
acceptance_criteria: Application passes OWASP security checks.
No critical vulnerabilities are found in automated security scans.
Security patches are applied promptly.

non_functional_requirements.title: Scalability
non_functional_requirements.description: The application should be able to scale to meet increased demand.
acceptance_criteria: Application supports 500 concurrent users without degradation.
Horizontal scaling is supported via Docker.
Load balancer is configured for scaling.

non_functional_requirements.title: Reliability
non_functional_requirements.description: Ensure high availability and reliability of the application.
acceptance_criteria: Application maintains 99.9% uptime.
Automated failover mechanisms are in place.
Regular backups are configured and tested.

non_functional_requirements.title: Usability
non_functional_requirements.description: The application should be user-friendly and intuitive.
acceptance_criteria: User testing results in a satisfaction score of 4.5/5.
User interface is consistent and intuitive.
Documentation is clear and comprehensive.

assumptions: The legacy codebase is fully functional and the modernization will not alter existing business logic.
TypeScript will be used without introducing additional frameworks unless necessary.
Docker is the preferred method for local deployment and testing.

risks.description: Potential loss of functionality during code translation.
risks.mitigation: Thorough testing and validation against legacy functionality.

risks.description: Security vulnerabilities introduced during modernization.
risks.mitigation: Regular security audits and use of secure coding practices.

risks.description: Performance degradation due to inefficient TypeScript code.
Compatibility issues with Docker deployment.
risks.mitigation: Use of standardized Docker configurations and testing.

out_of_scope: Integration with external systems not present in the legacy codebase.
Introduction of new features beyond existing functionality.

intake.business_request_raw: Modernize the provided legacy codebase into TypeScript. Document current functionality and acceptance criteria, design architecture, implement rewritten services, run QA/security checks, validate requirements, and deploy for local Docker testing.

analyst_summary.overview: Analyst inference for vishakjai/legacyasptest: repository structure and sampled source files indicate a multi-module application with 0 discovered route hints. Objective alignment used: Modernize the provided legacy codebase into TypeScript. Document current functionality and acceptance criteria, design architecture, implement rewritten services, run QA/security checks, validate requirements, and deploy

team.name: Synthetix Modernization Team
team.description: Legacy modernization team focused on functional parity and migration safety.

1.persona: Prioritize legacy parity, interface contracts, backward compatibility, and modernization risk documentation.

2.persona: Map legacy flows to modern services while minimizing migration risk and preserving business behavior.

3.persona: Rewrite legacy logic with functional parity first, then improve modularity without changing behavior.

4.persona: Design low-risk schema/data migration scripts with rollback plans and validation checkpoints.

5.persona: Produce threat models, prioritized security controls, and release-gating recommendations.

6.persona: Run actionable checks, separate environment issues from code defects, and produce clear remediation guidance.

7.persona: Validate requirement coverage clearly for business stakeholders with traceable evidence.

8.persona: Prefer local Docker deployability, deterministic health checks, and clear run instructions.

TypeScript component template for rendering HTML with security in mind.

key_themes: Health assessment of the legacy ASP codebase, identifying key areas for improvement in maintainability, security, and reliability.
summary.recommendation: Prioritize P0/P1 remediation items and enforce convention gates in CI
summary.notes: Generated from SIL health assessment and remediation backlog

findings.title: Hotspot: includes/customer.asp
findings.description: Potential for injection attacks due to insufficient input validation.

findings.title: Security Vulnerability
findings.description: Potential for injection attacks due to insufficient input validation.

findings.title: Error Handling Deficiency
findings.description: Lack of structured error handling could lead to unhandled exceptions.

backlog.title: Implement Input Validation
plan: Implement input validation and sanitization using TypeScript libraries
acceptance_criteria: All user inputs are validated and sanitized.
No security vulnerabilities related to input handling.

backlog.title: Implement Structured Error Handling
backlog.business_value: Potential for unhandled exceptions leading to application crashes.
plan: Use try-catch blocks in TypeScript to handle errors gracefully
acceptance_criteria: All potential error points are covered with try-catch blocks.
Application does not crash due to unhandled exceptions.

analysis_walkthrough.business_objective_summary: Modernize a legacy ASP codebase to TypeScript, ensuring functionality is preserved and documented, with deployment for testing in Docker.
requirements_understanding: The legacy codebase includes session management, customer login, and order processing.
The modernization effort requires TypeScript as the target language.
Backward compatibility and functionality parity are critical.
Deployment for local Docker testing is required.
conversion_to_technical_requirements: Each ASP script function will be mapped to a TypeScript function or module.
Session management will be handled using a modern session library compatible with TypeScript.
Customer and order data will be managed using a TypeScript-compatible data store.
Docker will be used for containerized testing environments.
clarifications_requested: Are there any specific TypeScript frameworks or libraries that should be used?
What are the performance expectations for the modernized application?

analyst_output.executive_summary: This project aims to modernize a legacy ASP codebase to TypeScript, preserving existing functionality and ensuring compatibility, with deployment for Docker-based testing.

functional_requirements.title: Session Management
functional_requirements.description: Implement session management in TypeScript to track user sessions and total active sessions.
acceptance_criteria: Session start increases the total session count by 1.
Session end decreases the total session count by 1.
Sessions store user authentication status and username.

functional_requirements.title: User Authentication
functional_requirements.description: Implement user login functionality in TypeScript, allowing users to authenticate with a username.
acceptance_criteria: User login requires a non-empty username.
Successful login sets session as authenticated and stores the username.
Failed login due to empty username displays an error message.

functional_requirements.title: Customer Data Management
functional_requirements.description: Manage customer data in TypeScript, allowing retrieval and display of customer information.
acceptance_criteria: Customer data is stored in a TypeScript-compatible data store.
Customer list is displayed with ID and name.
Customer data retrieval is secure and efficient.

functional_requirements.title: Order Creation
functional_requirements.description: Implement order creation functionality in TypeScript, allowing users to create new orders.
acceptance_criteria: Order creation requires customer ID, status, and total amount.
Orders are stored with a unique ID and timestamp.
Invalid input results in an error message and no order is created.

functional_requirements.title: Order Update
functional_requirements.description: Implement order update functionality in TypeScript, allowing users to update order status.
acceptance_criteria: Order updates require a valid order ID and new status.
Order status is updated in the data store.
Invalid order ID results in an error message.

functional_requirements.title: Data Encoding
functional_requirements.description: Ensure all user inputs and outputs are properly encoded to prevent security vulnerabilities.
acceptance_criteria: All HTML outputs are encoded to prevent XSS attacks.
All inputs are validated and sanitized.
Encoding functions are tested for edge cases.

functional_requirements.title: Flash Messaging
functional_requirements.description: Implement flash messaging in TypeScript to provide feedback to users on actions.
acceptance_criteria: Flash messages are displayed after user actions.
Messages are cleared after being displayed once.
Flash messages support different types (info, error).

functional_requirements.title: Docker Deployment
functional_requirements.description: Deploy the modernized application in a Docker container for local testing.
acceptance_criteria: Application runs successfully in a Docker container.
Docker setup includes all necessary dependencies.
Application is accessible via a local URL.

non_functional_requirements.title: Performance
non_functional_requirements.description: The modernized application should perform efficiently under expected load.
non_functional_requirements.metric: Response time under 200ms for 95% of requests.
acceptance_criteria: Load testing shows response time under 200ms for 95% of requests.
Application scales to handle 100 concurrent users.
Performance metrics are logged and monitored.

non_functional_requirements.title: Security
non_functional_requirements.description: Ensure the application is secure against common vulnerabilities.
non_functional_requirements.metric: No critical vulnerabilities in security scans.
acceptance_criteria: Application passes OWASP security checks.
No critical vulnerabilities are found in automated security scans.
Security patches are applied promptly.

non_functional_requirements.title: Scalability
non_functional_requirements.description: The application should be able to scale to meet increased demand.
acceptance_criteria: Application supports 500 concurrent users without degradation.
Horizontal scaling is supported via Docker.
Load balancer is configured for scaling.

non_functional_requirements.title: Reliability
non_functional_requirements.description: Ensure high availability and reliability of the application.
acceptance_criteria: Application maintains 99.9% uptime.
Automated failover mechanisms are in place.
Regular backups are configured and tested.

non_functional_requirements.title: Usability
non_functional_requirements.description: The application should be user-friendly and intuitive.
acceptance_criteria: User testing results in a satisfaction score of 4.5/5.
User interface is consistent and intuitive.
Documentation is clear and comprehensive.

assumptions: The legacy codebase is fully functional and the modernization will not alter existing business logic.
TypeScript will be used without introducing additional frameworks unless necessary.
Docker is the preferred method for local deployment and testing.

risks.description: Potential loss of functionality during code translation.
risks.mitigation: Thorough testing and validation against legacy functionality.

risks.description: Security vulnerabilities introduced during modernization.
risks.mitigation: Regular security audits and use of secure coding practices.

risks.description: Performance degradation due to inefficient TypeScript code.
Compatibility issues with Docker deployment.
risks.mitigation: Use of standardized Docker configurations and testing.

out_of_scope: Integration with external systems not present in the legacy codebase.
Introduction of new features beyond existing functionality.

intake.business_request_raw: Modernize the provided legacy codebase into TypeScript. Document current functionality and acceptance criteria, design architecture, implement rewritten services, run QA/security checks, validate requirements, and deploy for local Docker testing.
assumptions: The legacy codebase is fully functional and the modernization will not alter existing business logic.
TypeScript will be used without introducing additional frameworks unless necessary.
Docker is the preferred method for local deployment and testing.

Map acceptance criteria to executable test types.

scenarios.name: Successful login
gherkin: Given a user with a valid username
When the user attempts to log in
Then the user is authenticated and redirected to the dashboard

scenarios.name: Create a new order
gherkin: Given a logged-in user
When the user submits a valid order form
Then a new order is created and stored

scenarios.name: Update an existing order
gherkin: Given a logged-in user
And an existing order
When the user updates the order status
Then the order status is updated in the system

scenarios.name: Track active sessions
gherkin: Given a user starts a session
When the session is active
Then the total session count is incremented
